sub_title: Enterprise IT Architect (Masters) | Payments & Cards Application Architect | zOS Architect | Cloud Solution Architect
summary:
An Experienced DevOps IT Professional with a degree in Masters in Enterprise IT Architecture offering 14+ years of dedicated experience in working with Financial and Banking domains for 2 biggest bank of Netherlands ie Rabobank and ABNAMRO. Worked as Application and Solution architect for domains like Payments and Accounts, VAM, Swift, Cash and Cards, BI (Business Intelligence), OCRM, Mobile/Internet Banking, Customer, Sales and Services. Accomplished and fluent communicator with strong investigation, problem-solving and decision-making skills, combined with a pragmatic approach aligning with Business vision. 
Experience with Architectural IT Solution Projects. Hands on experience on several architectural IT Solution projects involving Payments and Accounts, Secure Payment transfer, Platform Migration, SOA, Cloud integration, Decommissioning and Integration Projects


DOMAIN EXPERTISE
RABOBANK:
Cards (Card Management, ACI Issuer, Base24 EPS, Idemia, Equens, Track and Trace)
New Current Account 
GPS (Payment Routing and governance)
FTM (Payment Engine)
Virtual Account Manager

ABNAMRO
o	Business Intelligence
o	TOPS2020 
o	Payments and Swift
o	Credits and Mortgages
o	OCRM
o	Integration (TIR,TIGA)

certifications.name: Design & Engineering Methodology for Organizations- DEMO Bachelor

projects.title: CASH2020 - Migrating to new Geldmaat ATM

authors.headline: Enterprise IT Architect (Masters) | Payments & Cards Application Architect | zOS Architect | Cloud Solution Architect

profile_positions.description:
Payments and Accounts is part of CASP domain within Rabobank and is responsible for managing payment account agreement and also responsible for calculating and settlement of interest, commission and cost. It is the core of the payment system and supports various applications within and outside Rabobank to execute its work.
My responsibility includes:
1. Ensuing that the services adhere to all security standards
2. Supporting the Business Architect in defining the PSA
3. Establishing new interfaces w.r.t our application
4. Part of the zOS innovative team to define and design new technology within mainframe
5. Setting up of Environments for testing
6. Service catalogue creation
7. Supporting Scrum teams in their daily work by eliminating impediments related with Enterprise Solution team
8. Working with security team to mitigate all possible threats by performing test requirements for team
profile_positions.title: Payments & Accounts – Application and Solution Architect - Rabobank

profile_positions.description:
Digital Container Shipping Association (DCSA) creates vendor- neutral, technology-agnostic, standards for IT and non- competitive business practices for all its partners which involves carriers (including containers), partners and consumers. Due to the type of industry, it still operates majorly with a non-IT approach where interactions between partners/stakeholders are still done on paper instead of digital medium like services.
My responsibility included:
1. Understanding the Current Architecture and draft the Target State Architecture involving the usage of services
2. Proposal for introducing PAAS solution within the organization which can be linked together with all the stakeholders
3. Understanding the service requirement from Business and creating the Solution Architecture document along with Security Document for DCSA.
profile_positions.title: Consultant and Digital Transformation Architect - DCSA

profile_positions.description:
Payments and Cards domain within Rabobank NL handles core card functionality (Debit and Credit). The domain also comprises interacting with external parties for card lifecyclemanagement and card transaction processing like ACI, Idemia and Equens.
My responsibility includes :
● Creating an architectural roadmap to migrate the legacy cards application to UPF ACI platform. I am responsible for creating TAS (technical architectural specification), contributing to PSA along with Business architect and creating interface designs for all relevant connections.
● Interacting with ING, ABNAMRO, Geldmaat and G4S for creating solutions for the Cash2020 project.
● Solution architect for VTS project where customers will now have an option to use VISA card
● Ensuring all card interfaces are secured using security management.
● Creating a new card interface using ACI Issuer.
● Decommissioning TSYS.
● Executing risk assessment for all card based applications.
● Creating applicative landscape and ensuring that applications are built as per standards and guidelines laid by Architects
profile_positions.title: Cards Application Architect - Rabobank

profile_positions.description:
New Current Account and GPS are the core Payments application system within Rabobank, which is responsible to hold all the bookings information of Rabobank. I was part of both the Scrum teams ie one responsible for creating services for Customer (CNA)  and other team which aimed to connect all payments engine and channelize the booking to Current account system(GPS).
My responsibility included:
1. Creating applicative landscape and ensuring that applications are built as per standards and guidelines laid by Architects
2. Doing PoCs for new interfaces like Cloud integration, implementing Signing, Encryption, infrastructure setup etc
3. Part of Optimisation task force which aimed to reduce MSU. Successfully executed them in both CNA and GPS
4. Creating ISRM , Current state architecture, Future state architecture, Exchange Patterns for Payments and Accounts domain
5. Responsible for validating solutions and governance on quality
6. Assisting Business Analyst on drafting the solutions along with  Risk assessment, Gap analysis, Infrastructural setup and coordinating between all stakeholders on agreement of the solutions
7. Creating  Robust Solutions for GPS Application to integrate it with all payment engines.
8. Creating Solutions/landscape for decommissioning old legacy payment system.
profile_positions.title: Payments Application Architect - Rabobank

profile_positions.description:
Business Intelligence domain was solely responsible for proving Enterprise Microstrategy reporting to end customers. Apart from Microstrategy reporting, the domain also had Customer Intelligence i.e. campaign management implemented through SAS.

My responsibility included:
1. Scrum Master of the migration Project of Business Objects Reports and Tallyman’s Crystal reports to Microstrategy reports. 
2. Managed development team and addressed their concerns for smooth project execution.
3. Investigated the probable candidates for project scope and created projects for them
4. Was Solution Architect and Designer for the CC AV2 scrambling project in Mainframe z/OS, impacting 140 ICT applications across bank. 
5. Translated business requirements into detailed architectures and design for CC AV2 scrambling project.
profile_positions.title: Business Intelligence

profile_positions.description:
TOPS2020 program was a re-architecture program which was supposed to get completed by 2020. The program involved Clean (decommissioning of applications), TReP (Technical re-platforming, Fencing (using IFW framework to implement SOA) and Rationalization (Optimization)

My responsibility included :
1. Translating the Non Functional and Functional requirements into realistic design with risk,its mitigations and Efforts involved
2. Worked with Enterprise architect to define scope for Payments subdomain for Tops2020 program.
3. Led the Clean and TReP program from the central team and ensuring that we meet the committed saving thus, saving of 2 million Euros for 2014 for Transactions domain.
4. Assisted/Supported IBM in executing the decommissioning process in phased manner with minimal impact to business as usual
5. Created a revised and new process helping AAB in their governance and also ensuring that rework/operational cost is minimal
profile_positions.title: TOPS 2020 Program

profile_positions.description:
Payment and Swift was the core application under Transactions domain in ABNAMRO. This domain was responsible for handling all payment related booking for ABNAMRO.

My responsibility included
1. Created the architectural solution for new Payment system (for EBA, Equens and Duetdeff) by connecting to SAA (Swift Alliance Access), SAG (Swift Alliance Gateway) with Swift using MQFTE and securing it with cryptography (within Mainframe).
2. Helped Project and Product team by providing documents containing gap analysis and defining mitigation solution for failover mechanism via SFTP for the new Payment system created.
3. Create automatic monitoring system for Payments thus complying to better governance within the Payments domain
4. Created all documents wrt my work and all new interfaces which was referred by OPS in case of any incident for quick resolutions.
profile_positions.title: Payment and Swift

profile_positions.description:
OCRM domain was an integral and most crucial domain of ABNAMRO dealing with ERP system and serving Retail, C&MB and Private Clients. This domain was responsible for Customer Relationship management and has varied number of applications like Siebel, PeopleSoft (was to be phased out) and Klantbeeld Medewerker which served several functionalities for Credits, Mortgages(Hypotheken), Payments, Insurances (Verzekeringen), Investment, Account (Spaarrekening and Betaalrekening), Cash and Cards, Customer & Finance, Sales and Services, Advices, Internet banking etc.

My responsibility included
1. Led the team and implemented major projects like Een Klantbeeld, Smart Navigation, Upgrade Projects, Batch Optimization and MIPS related projects
2. Created several techno-functional requirements (BWR/RFC) for financial services like Payments, Cash and Cards, Insurances, Customer, Accounts, Internet Banking etc.
3. Drove impressive improvements across the business as a result of IT Solution’s implementation like Een Klantbeeld and Smart Navigation which made operational saving of more than 1 million Euros.
4. Excelled in guiding the work of technical teams. Articulated project goals and scope, translated business needs into technical terms, prepared detailed work breakdown structures (WBS) and instilled shared accountability for achieving project milestones.
5. Generated Optimization/Restructuring ideas and hence saving on operational cost for the domain.
6. Was able to get customer satisfaction of more than 90% throughout the years, due to innovative ideas implemented and proposed by me.
profile_positions.title: OCRM - Operational CRM & Sales & Services

profile_positions.description: TIGA * TIR was the Integration program between Fortis and ABNAMRO. I was responsible within the core Integration team to build solutions, implement and test along with Logica for the successful integration of all impacted applications.
profile_positions.title: TIGA & TIR- Technical Integration Fortis

profile_positions.description:
OCRM domain was an integral and most crucial domain of ABNAMRO dealing with ERP system and serving Retail, C&MB and Private Clients. This domain was responsible for Customer Relationship management and has varied number of applications like Siebel, Peoplesoft (was to be phased out) and Klantbeeld Medewerker which served several functionalities for  Credits, Mortgages(Hypotheken), Payments, Insurances (Verzekeringen),  Investment, Account (Spaarrekening and Betaalrekening), Cash and Cards, Customer & Finance, Sales and Services, Advices, Internet banking etc.

My responsibility included
1. Drafted and executed several critical compliance projects like SEPA, MIFID, UCR, RBS Carve out etc
2. Managed all phases of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for several wishes/requirements
3. Mainframe Coding and Testing 
4. Creating test cases, test plan using HPQC
5. Application Support using Service Management tools
6. Project and Technical documentation
7. Reviewing code and documentation of peers
profile_positions.title: Multiple Roles
